metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28615 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may crash or disclose information due to a read beyond bounds in ap_strcmp_match() when provided with an extremely large input buffer. While no code distributed with the server can be coerced into such a call, third-party modules or lua scripts that use ap_strcmp_match() may hypothetically be affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-macro - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm6
